data.question: What is the chemical formula of ZAG-4?
What was the pressure range applied to ZAG-4 during the study?
Is the process of compression and decompression of ZAG-4 reversible?
What was used as a pressure medium in the study of ZAG-4?
What was the calculated bulk modulus of ZAG-4?
Did the unit cell volume of ZAG-4 decrease or increase under pressure?
What was the primary method used to investigate the structural change of ZAG-4 under high pressures?
data.answer: In situ single crystal X-ray diffraction

data.question: What was the maximum pressure ZAG-4 was subjected to before the gasket failed?
Did the crystal quality of ZAG-4 remain intact after decompression?
What was the role of alkyl chains in the structure of ZAG-4?
data.answer: To provide a spring-like cushion to stabilize the compression of the system

data.question: Is ZAG-4 considered a highly compressible framework?
What was the significant change in the β angle of ZAG-4 under pressure?
What phenomenon explains the negative linear compressibility observed in ZAG-4?
Was the change in the b-axis of ZAG-4 under pressure consistent?
data.answer: No, it exhibited both positive and negative linear compressibility

data.question: What was the purpose of adding ruby powder during the study of ZAG-4?
How was the pressure within the diamond anvil cell monitored?
data.answer: Via ruby fluorescence stimulated by a 100W 447 nm diode

data.question: Did the inorganic chain of ZAG-4 expand or contract in the b-axis direction under pressure?
data.answer: It expanded a little over 0.2 Å

data.question: Is the structural change of ZAG-4 under pressure attributed to the distortion of the 8-membered ring?
What was the effect of pressure on the hydrogen bonds within ZAG-4?
data.answer: The shortest hydrogen bond distance decreased from 2.557(3) to 2.37(2) Å

data.question: Are MOFs like ZAG-4 considered for applications as piezofunctional solid-state materials?
